title: Handle no-zoom case when arc show --current is empty

brief.why: The 'Last worked on' zoom depends on arc show --current returning an active tactical step. At session start (common case), no tactical steps are active — the zoom silently disappears. User sees outcomes but no action-level detail until they pick one.
brief.what: 1. Decide fallback: most recently completed action's outcome? Handoff-inferred outcome? Just skip? 2. Implement chosen fallback in open-context.sh 3. Test: fresh session with no active tactical, session mid-work, session after arc done
brief.done: Briefing shows meaningful zoom section even when no tactical steps are active.

title: Write handoff contract spec

brief.why: Aboyeur's conductor.sh greps for HUMAN REVIEW NEEDED and reads handoffs from ~/.claude/handoffs/<encoded-path>/. This dependency is implicit — if claude-suite changes encoding or escalation signal, aboyeur breaks silently. Need an explicit contract document.
brief.what: 1. Create protocol/HANDOFF-CONTRACT.md 2. Document: directory encoding (tr '/.' '-'), handoff location, filename convention 3. Document: required sections (Done/Next/Gotchas/Risks) and who reads them 4. Document: escalation signal (HUMAN REVIEW NEEDED as plaintext grep target) 5. Document: what's stable (encoding, signal) vs flexible (section headings, content structure)
brief.done: Aboyeur's README can point to this spec. Any future change to the handoff format starts with updating this document first.

title: Cross-repo audit workflow is encoded and discoverable

brief.why: Backlog review across 24 repos happens manually every time — 5-10 sessions of re-explaining the same workflow. Meanwhile skill-forge (the quality gate) gets skipped because skill-creator competes with it, and bonbons (the survey tool) is an orphan repo with one commit.
brief.what: 1. Fix skill-forge discoverability (alias skill-creator, rewrite description, add anti-rationalization block) 2. Absorb bonbons into trousse (move survey.py, delete repo) 3. Write audit_survey.py (enhanced survey with --json and age flags) 4. Write verification-patterns.md reference 5. Write audit SKILL.md (5-phase process skill) 6. Validate with skill-forge 7. Install and dry-run
brief.done: Running /audit triggers the skill, scans all repos, classifies items correctly, presents summary, and closes items on approval. skill-forge is always discovered before skill-creator.
